intro: Lamourouxia jaliscana, commonly known as the Jalisco orchid, is a rare and endemic orchid species native to the Mexican state of Jalisco. It is characterized by its delicate, fragrant flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and pale pink. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests at moderate elevations. Its leaves are lance-shaped and arranged in a rosette pattern, contributing to its unique appearance. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
